metadata.synopsis: Automatically initiated dialogue after players bash/prise open a coffin with Bugthimble, a tetchy and mistrustful Kobold, just trying to live her best life looting the coffin and the nasty adventurers dug her upt! She wears a face covering helmet.Players have either dug here expecting to find "Enough valuables to settle matters between us" as the note they found said (Tough letter, found on the Courier by Scratch) or just decided to dig up a grave for fun.
metadata.how_to_trigger: - Find the coffin by either knowing about the note and finding the specific grave, or by going on a looting spree in a graveyard- Dig it up and open it for a surprise Bugthimble!Bookmark: larian://bookmark?name=BGO_KurwinCoffin&mod=GustavDev&level=BGO_Main_A&camPos=-1744.178589;42.883114;706.366821&camTarget=-1743.758667;42.415478;705.588989

11.speaker: Bugthimble
11.text: You got cheese for brains? I told you to hop it.
11.context: CinematicNodeContext: DARK URGE RAGE AND THEN A BLUR

73.speaker: Bugthimble
73.text: 'ere! Whatcha doing? Get them sausage fingers off my crate!
73.context: CinematicNodeContext: DARK URGE RAGE AND THEN A BLUR

24.speaker: Player
24.text: What in the Hells? Were you buried in there?
24.context: CinematicNodeContext: DARK URGE RAGE AND THEN A BLUR

94.speaker: Bugthimble
94.context: CinematicNodeContext: DARK URGE RAGE AND THEN A BLUR

30.speaker: Bugthimble
30.text: I dug in, see? Looking for trinkets. Found 'em too.
30.context: CinematicNodeContext: DARK URGE RAGE AND THEN A BLUR

17.speaker: Bugthimble
17.text: And I found 'em first, so you can find your own bleedin' grave to rob.
17.context: CinematicNodeContext: DARK URGE RAGE AND THEN A BLUR

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Wonder if you've ever buried someone alive.
3.context: CinematicNodeContext: DARK URGE RAGE AND THEN A BLUR

46.speaker: Bugthimble
46.text: Owie, what you lookin' at? Rats! You look bad.
46.context: CinematicNodeContext: DARK URGE RAGE AND THEN A BLUR

37.speaker: Narrator
37.text: *Crinckle and crack go her bones, and the shards of old bones below.*
37.context: CinematicNodeContext: DARK URGE RAGE AND THEN A BLUR

41.speaker: Narrator
41.text: *Sprinkle and stamp goes the soil, piling on top of the coffin packed cosily back into the earth.*
41.context: CinematicNodeContext: DARK URGE RAGE AND THEN A BLUR

51.speaker: Bugthimble
51.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shot of the ground, freshly packed soil, implying she has been re-buried.NodeContext: Mumbled sounds from beneath the earth

78.speaker: Player
78.text: Resist the temptation to put her underground. Try to leave.
78.context: NodeContext: 'Ah ah ah' in the "No, not so fast" kind of way

1.speaker: Player
1.context: NodeContext: 'Ah ah ah' in the "No, not so fast" kind of way

42.speaker: Bugthimble
42.text: Ah ah ah - you can find your own bleedin' grave after you've paid the fee.
42.context: NodeContext: 'Ah ah ah' in the "No, not so fast" kind of way

57.speaker: Bugthimble
57.text: It's one of them 'letting you walk away with all your blood' kinda fees. ([GEN_CheckMagicPocketGold_6057ad05-9492-4630-9f0a-be548b134c54])

5.speaker: Bugthimble
5.text: Knew you'd be loaded. Sticky little gnome fingers.

54.speaker: Bugthimble
54.text: Now scram off - me 'n this crate got business.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: I don't have that much money!

64.speaker: Player
64.text: Hells no! You think I'm scared of a kobold?

29.speaker: Bugthimble
29.text: Nah, but that's fine. Prefer a dead gnome to the gold anyway.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: You'd ask this of me? We're practically kin.

43.speaker: Bugthimble
43.text: Eh, all right. Just don't tell no one, okay?

91.speaker: Bugthimble
91.text: Fine by me. I'd prefer a dead gnome to the gold anyway.

96.speaker: Player
96.text: Thank goodness. You can keep it.
96.context: NodeContext: Going for a triumphant "yeah, well you can fuck off" before you realise they said you could keep the crate

97.speaker: Bugthimble
97.text: Yeah, well you can - wait, what?
97.context: NodeContext: Going for a triumphant "yeah, well you can fuck off" before you realise they said you could keep the crate

77.speaker: Bugthimble
77.text: 's full of gold. Why don't you want it?

25.speaker: Bugthimble
25.text: Curse? There ain't no - is there?

90.speaker: Bugthimble
90.text: Curse? There ain't no - is there?

44.speaker: Bugthimble
44.text: Hells, what if there is? Ol' Rummy swore he was cursed 'til the day that Tarrasque stepped on him.

85.speaker: Bugthimble
85.text: No haul's worth that. To Hells with the crate and to Hells with you!

45.text: You think I got worms for brains? You smarmy, arrogant little scrat!

39.speaker: Bugthimble
39.text: You think I got worms for brains? You smarmy, arrogant little scrat!

23.speaker: Bugthimble
23.text: Oh I'm gonna cut you up so good.

80.speaker: Player
80.text: This 'crate' was promised to Nine-Fingers. You don't want to steal from her, do you?
80.context: NodeContext: Scared by Nine-Fingers, but it's a frustrated 'damn it.' This was a big haul after all.

32.speaker: Bugthimble
32.context: NodeContext: Scared by Nine-Fingers, but it's a frustrated 'damn it.' This was a big haul after all.

22.speaker: Bugthimble
22.context: NodeContext: Scared by Nine-Fingers, but it's a frustrated 'damn it.' This was a big haul after all.

82.speaker: Bugthimble
82.text: Look, I didn't know it was the lady's. How could I? Ain't no one's name on it.

59.speaker: Bugthimble
59.text: So it's yours, okay? Nine-Fingers gets her crate, I get to keep breathing and everyone's good, yeah?

9.speaker: Player
9.context: InternalNodeContext: Kobold tunnels away and leaves the loot to the player

89.speaker: Player
89.text: That depends. I charge a fee for not breaking your snout.
89.context: InternalNodeContext: Kobold tunnels away and leaves the loot to the player

28.speaker: Bugthimble
28.text: Oh. Yeah. Sure, just eh - wait right here.
28.context: InternalNodeContext: Kobold tunnels away and leaves the loot to the player

93.speaker: Bugthimble
93.text: Oh. Yeah. Sure, just eh - wait right here.

99.context: InternalNodeContext: Kobold tunnels away and leaves the loot to the player

40.speaker: Bugthimble
40.context: InternalNodeContext: Kobold tunnels away and leaves the loot to the player

26.speaker: Bugthimble
26.text: You what? I'll gut you for this!

63.text: Nah, I work hard to stay off the Guild's map. Don't wanna get on the lady's bad side.

86.speaker: Bugthimble
86.text: Nah, I work hard to stay off the Guild's map. Don't wanna get on the lady's bad side.

56.speaker: Bugthimble
56.text: Mind you, she don't know I'm here. And she won't know - not if I bury your snitchin' carcass right here!

52.speaker: Bugthimble
52.text: That so? I'll just help myself, then.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: I'll just take what I want from your corpse.

66.speaker: Bugthimble
66.text: I didn't wanna kill no dragon kin. Doesn't mean I won't, though.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: Hand it over or I'll bury you in that hole, kobold.
47.context: NodeContext: A little sulky, she's just lost out on her prize and trying not

60.speaker: Player
60.text: You'd take this from a dragon kin? Despite our shared blood?
60.context: NodeContext: A little sulky, she's just lost out on her prize and trying not

71.speaker: Bugthimble
71.text: Eh, I mean... When you put it like that...
71.context: NodeContext: A little sulky, she's just lost out on her prize and trying not

2.speaker: Bugthimble
2.text: All right, fine. Neither you nor the box're worth the trouble.
2.context: NodeContext: A little sulky, she's just lost out on her prize and trying not

7.speaker: Player
7.text: The magic of dragons flows in my veins, kobold. Do not test me.

62.speaker: Bugthimble
62.text: Oh yeah? I'll gut you good!

67.speaker: Player
67.text: It's not a crate and it's definitely not yours.
67.context: NodeContext: Coming to a worrying realisation

70.speaker: Bugthimble
70.text: Is too! I tunnelled in for a little thieving. Same as you, looks like.

68.speaker: Bugthimble
68.text: Well, you're too late. This one's mine - you can find your own grave to rob.

95.speaker: Player
95.context: NodeContext: Coming to a worrying realisation

61.speaker: Bugthimble
61.text: I just know what you're like. All sneaky 'n tricky 'n trying to steal someone else's haul.

92.speaker: Bugthimble
92.text: Well I didn't tunnel into this grave to have my haul stolen by you! Find your own pit to pillage.

50.speaker: Player
50.text: What are you doing in my father's grave?!
50.context: NodeContext: Coming to a worrying realisation

65.speaker: Bugthimble
65.text: Father? Ain't no bones in there, just gold.
65.context: NodeContext: Coming to a worrying realisation

20.speaker: Bugthimble
20.text: Father? Ain't no bones in there, just gold.
20.context: NodeContext: Coming to a worrying realisation

6.speaker: Bugthimble
6.text: 'less his bones didn't stay buried. 'less they rose up to join the Absolute. Or who knows what else...
6.context: NodeContext: Coming to a worrying realisation

36.speaker: Bugthimble
36.text: No, you can keep Daddy's gold. Just don't blame me if he comes lookin' for it.

48.text: Ouuu, 'father' is it? Come to pay your respects by digging up Daddy?
48.context: NodeContext: Doesn't believe the player and is mocking their lie

19.speaker: Bugthimble
19.text: Ouuu, 'father' is it? Come to pay your respects by digging up Daddy?
19.context: NodeContext: Doesn't believe the player and is mocking their lie

76.speaker: Bugthimble
76.text: Nah, didn't think so. You ain't much of a liar, but you done one thing right.

87.speaker: Bugthimble
87.text: You dug a nice, big hole I can hide your stupid corpse in!

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Sorry, I'll let you rest in peace.

53.speaker: Bugthimble
53.text: Whoa whoa - not so hasty. You can piss off after you've paid my fee.
